title: Nomination Sent to the Senate for U.S. District Judges for the Eastern and Western Districts of Louisiana and for United States Marshal
summary: The White House announced that nominations have been sent to the Senate for three individuals: William J. Crain, of Louisiana, to be United States District Judge for the Eastern District of Louisiana, to fill the vacancy created by the retirement of Eldon E. Fallon; Alexander C. Van Hook, of Louisiana, to be United States District Judge for the Western District of Louisiana, to fill the vacancy created by the retirement of Elizabeth Erny Foote; and Brian Barber, of Louisiana, to be United States Marshal.

title: National Energy Dominance Month, 2025 Proclamation
summary: A presidential proclamation designating National Energy Dominance Month in 2025 and describing the United States' abundance of energy resources, including oil, coal, minerals, and natural gas, and noting their historical role in supporting the economy and energy security.

title: Proclamation: National Cybersecurity Awareness Month, 2025
summary: This proclamation announces National Cybersecurity Awareness Month for 2025 and states the President's renewed commitment to strengthening the United States' cybersecurity. It describes goals to improve American lives, defend national sovereignty, and protect the rights of citizens, and notes that recent advances in cybersecurity have introduced new threats to national defense, underscoring the importance of heightened awareness and coordinated action across government, industry, and the public.

title: Proclamation Adjusting Imports of Medium- and Heavy-Duty Vehicles, Vehicle Parts, and Buses into the United States Based on National Security Review
summary: The proclamation states that three weeks earlier the Secretary of Commerce transmitted a report on the effects of imports of medium- and heavy-duty vehicles (MHDVs), their parts (MHDVPs), and buses on United States national security. Based on the findings, the President issues a proclamation to adjust imports of these goods into the United States under applicable authority, with the aim of addressing the national security concerns identified in the report. The action applies to medium- and heavy-duty vehicles, their parts, and buses and is intended to reflect the conclusions of the commerce department's review.

title: Memorandum on Use of Available Department of War Funds for Military Pay and Allowances During Lapse in Annual Appropriations
summary: This memorandum addresses whether funds currently available to the Department of War may be used to pay military personnel and related allowances during a lapse in annual appropriations by Congress, describing the scope of the lapse and referencing the authority or limitations governing such reallocation of funds. The document is addressed to the Secretary of War and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget.

title: Executive Order: Ensuring Continued Accountability in Federal Hiring
summary: This executive order describes the administration's approach to federal hiring accountability, providing background on changes to the federal workforce and outlining aims to improve the efficiency of government services while prioritizing recruitment in national security areas. It emphasizes establishing standards and processes to ensure accountable hiring practices across federal agencies.
